Casual Customer Sales & Service Consultant Bourke St, Elizabeth St, Exhibition St, Melbourne Central

Company Name Telstra Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Connect with Telstra

We’re at the heart of technological change and we’re helping to make it happen by connecting everything to everyone. And that’s where you come in, to help us create a brilliantly connected future for our customers.

About The Role

We are seeking expressions of interest from talented individuals who thrive in a fast paced customer service environment and are looking for their next career opportunity. Our Expression of Interest is extended to our Bourke St, Elizabeth St, Exhibition St, Melbourne Central Telstra stores.

At Telstra, we know that our people are our greatest asset and that’s why we’re always looking for brilliant individuals who embody our values and have a passion for technology.

As part of our Customer Sales and Service Consultants team, you will be the face and voice of Telstra. Talking to our new and existing customers, you’ll deliver personalised service and advice to uncover their individual needs and provide them with great solutions.

On any given day, you could be sharing your knowledge about our services and the latest technology, or talking to a customer about our international roaming offers for their next holiday. It’s challenging and varied work that you can be proud of.

What You’ll Bring

As our customers are at the heart of everything we do, their happiness is our success, so you’ll need to go above and beyond to meet their needs.

This means we’re looking for people who have the confidence to speak with customers face to face, are resourceful and resilient, and are able to show us their natural enthusiasm for working with people.

You'll also need to be receptive to different personalities, and use varied approaches in your interactions with others.

No previous technical knowledge is required, just your passion for people and learning, as we’ll provide you with all the training you’ll need.

Sounds like you?

If you have a passion for retail and can deliver a unique, memorable experience to our customers every time they enter our store – a job at Telstra is for you!

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services
  • Online Media
  • Telecommunications

Full-time

 successful and global cloud based software Solutions Company located in one of Melbourne's inner suburbs.

Your new role

Job description


JOB ID: 180675
SALARY RANGE: $96,394 to $110,364 pa (plus 17% super)
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full-time (36.75 hours per week) and continuing
LOCATION: Geelong Waterfront Campus

ABOUT THE ROLE

Deakin University has a well-deserved global reputation for pushing the limits of digital innovation. Our team is the powerhouse behind our ambitious digital strategy and roadmap, working across a range of emerging technologies, differentiating solutions, enterprise applications, platforms, integrations and user experience teams.

We are looking for talented, enthusiastic digital specialists to join our team to help progress our digital agenda. If you want to be part of an innovative and exciting team then we would like to hear from you.

This will include:

  • Leading the design and development of enterprise-level digital products, services and solutions while contributing to their enhancement and extension, inclusive of technology.
  • Providing direction in complex application problem solving, and contributing specialist skills and knowledge to the evaluation and assessment of the ideas, concepts and solutions generated.
  • Rapidly designing, developing and iterating ideas, concepts and emergent technologies into innovative digital applications, products or services.
  • Providing expert advice and applying appropriate technical skills on the implementation, integration, support and other matters associated with emergent and enterprise technologies.



ABOUT YOU

  • Graduate qualifications in Computer Science/Information Technology, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Extensive experience in web, systems and application development with demonstrated expertise across a variety of platforms, with a strong record of leading and completing projects.
  • Significant experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) in large enterprise environment.
  • Strong development skills in a wide range platforms or programming languages.


For a full list of the selection criteria please see the position description
CONTACT FOR FURTHER INFORMATION: Aaron Whitehand, Tel: +61 3 5227 8843, Email: aaron.whitehand@deakin.edu.au

CLOSING DATE: Sunday 9 September 2018


We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Further information on Deakin's workplace benefits can be found here: deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin/why-work-at-deakin/staff-benefits

TO APPLY
For a full copy of the position description and to apply online, please visit deakin.edu.au/about-deakin/work-at-deakin

Deakin University values diversity, enables access and promotes inclusion.

Deakin University is an employer of choice for women and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Project Director – Family Violence and Child Safe Standards

Company Name Mercy Health Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role

The Project Director will provide organisational leadership, advocacy and oversight of the family violence strategy across Mercy Hospitals Victoria Limited. Primary responsibility will be for the planning, implementation, evaluation and sustainability of the Strengthening Hospitals Response to Family Violence (SHRFV) project as well as ensuring compliance with Child Safe Standards.
This whole of service response will be supported by the family violence team including subject matter expertise, training coordination and other support services as required.
The Project Director will have significant stakeholder engagement and partnership management internally and externally to elevate the profile and recognition necessary to ensure best practice, optimal response and appropriate policy and governance frameworks are in place.
  • Option for full time or part time, two year term
  • Flexibility with where the role is based – Mercy Hospital for Women in Heidelberg, Werribee Mercy Hospital, or O’Connell Family Centre in Canterbury
  • Grow and enhance the project team
  • Optimise whole of health service competence, capacity and capability to respond to and improve outcomes for patients and staff who are experiencing family violence or who are at risk.
About You
  • Post graduate or working towards postgraduate qualifications in a health related discipline, social sciences, arts, gender / womens studies, health administration or relevant field
  • Formal qualifications in project management desirable
  • Experience driving cultural change or leading organisation-wide development programs
  • Demonstrated project management experience delivering end to end projects and working with multiple stakeholders
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team – strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to influence and motivate are key to this role
  • Experience in Family Violence work is not essential, however interest in and passion for this topic needed
About Us

Mercy Health is a Catholic organisation employing over 8500 people who provide compassionate and holistic care through our acute hospitals, aged care facilities, mental health programs, palliative and respite services, maternity and women’s health services, early parenting services and home care services.
Mercy Health is proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the WGEA.

What We Offer
  • Values driven culture
  • Salary packaging benefits
  • Leadership Capability Framework to support your career progression and development
  • Camp Australia School Holiday Program
  • Thrive @ Mercy – our health & wellbeing hub supporting you to be the best you can be
  • Stepping Stones – our flexibility framework supporting your growth and work life balance
  • Fully funded childcare referral service
To find out more about these exciting initiatives, please visit Mercy Health Careers homepage (http//careers.mercy.com.au/)

At Mercy Health we pride ourselves on embracing diversity and foster an inclusive culture where individual differences are respected and celebrated. We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities and cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Associate

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Hospital & Health Care

846436984:
[

Product Manager

Company Name Moose Toys Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Moose Toys exists to make children happy. The team has innovation in their DNA and are famous for the design, development and manufacture of award winning toys that continue to disrupt the market!

Moose Toys dominates in categories including collectables, craft, dolls, games and youth electronics featuring much loved brands such as: Shopkins, Little Live Pets, Beados, Happy Places, The Grossery Gang, The Trash Pack and Mighty Beanz and is consistently recognised as the most creative company in the industry.

Moose Toys calls Australia home and has teams across Los Angeles, Hong Kong, China, London, Paris and Vietnam, employing more than 350+ staff and distributing to over 100 countries. Today, Moose Toys is on the hunt for a Product Manager

Role Objective

This role is fully accountable for delivery of complex products from cross-functional teams. Contribute to and drive the delivery of the road map set by company directors.

Your role will be to plan, prioritize, track, and report on schedule of physical products that are under different development stages, escalating issues where necessary. Ensure the effective project management of new product development from initial concept and prototyping, through to production start and post-sale support.

This role will be the main contact with the internal design team, outsourced design studios worldwide and the engineering team in Asia. Work closely with the senior management team to communicate challenges and potential project risks, providing solutions where required.

Skills And Experience
  • Strong understanding of project management principles and Agile development methodologies.
  • A working knowledge of the product development process.
  • Ability to work in a collaborative and interdisciplinary environment.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail, organisation and time management skills.
  • Creative problem solving and strong analytic capability. The ability to summarize and present complicated information to a non-technical audience.
  • Proficient in MS Excel and Project.
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and report on multiple projects with shifting priorities.
  • Ability to collaborate with, and effectively influence cross-functional product development teams internally and overseas.
  • Ability to work independently, adapt quickly, and stay effective in dynamic situations.
  • Enthusiastic about making toys.

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for creating, planning and tracking project schedules; monitoring progress against global new product launches, plan ensuring development schedule are aligned.
  • Responsible for driving the development team to start development of new products per development calendar; facilitating development meetings, communicating action plans developed by the team; and reporting status internally to Product Design, Marketing, and Senior Management. Escalating issues or risks and providing potential solutions.
  • Recommend creative ideas or method to reduce development lead time and troubleshoot off-track projects.
  • Responsible for driving project teams, communicating changes to all relevant stakeholders throughout the development process, including management, product development, creative, sales and marketing and Hong Kong and China teams.
  • Responsible for confirming product's cost are within the appropriate target at each milestone. Accountable for highlighting costing issues and supporting defined cost reduction efforts take place to meet brand profit goal.
  • Responsible for the preparation of all necessary materials for assigned brands at trade shows and key presentations, including product selections and module design direction.
  • Support Product Design team to ensure effective communication with external partners such as licensors, inventors, suppliers and distributors both nationally and internationally through relevant stages of product development.
  • Maintain management reports and ensure data integrity in information systems.

If this role sounds like you APPLY today!

4 years project management experience in consumer product development

Tertiary qualification in Science, Engineering or Arts

Prior experience in design will be highly regarded
